channel.title: Court Wizard Rework
channel.description:
Court Wizard is a pretty boring class. After discovering its roots, I have come up with this:
>**[color=blue]Court Wizard (Unique Blue Dragon Support)[/color]** > > Night Ability: Tornado: Swap two players, making anyone who targets one of them target the other. Unlimited uses. Bypasses occupation immunity. > > Night Ability 2: Magic Barrier: Prevent all negative effects on two targets besides death tonight, and the next day. 2 uses. Does not prevent death, poison, or bleeding.
Sage would remain the same.
Change log: 1: Barrier does not stop bleeding. 2: Made Unique 3: Formatting

item.title: Court Wizard Rework
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

The significance is that it is a day Ability. Occupy Immunity bypassing isn’t a problem for jail as an example. Aka: Since empower is a day Ability we can make the text this: “Your night Ability’s resolve first and bypass night immunitys tonight.” This way there is no conflict because it resolves before HH or anything else exept for Imprison has a chance to stop it. Putting it on the ability itself would not resolve the issue because there would still be the question of what happens if you swap yourself into an Occupy. Here it resolves before the Occupy has a chance to do anything so it would fail. At most you would just need to tweak the wording until it worked.

You could just have a passive to cover that.

NuclearBurrito:

Also the Possessor and Sorcerer. They are kinda important for this Ability.

Most of the time it isn’t a catastrophe if Sorcerer or Possessor kills somebody else.

Also, I’m putting this idea on another thread I made for all my class reworks here. I’d like more feedback on this and on the other ideas.

item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Limiting empowers doesn’t help. What if that happens and you empower?

The only classes that need it for a balance reason are King and Prince, and Prince doesn’t visit target with execute, and it’s not a huge disaster if Guards! changes targets. The main problem is switching an Order Execution, but you should generally coordinate with King about that.

item.title: Court Wizard Rework
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Occupy Immunity isn’t for benefiting a certain class. It’s to stop either weird situations (2 Butler occupying each other) or balance reason (like the King).

There is no circumstance where we need to consider making sure occupy immunity is still useful.

item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Most abilities can lead to unfortunate outcomes. You can check a framed target. You can Cold Steel a blue dragon member and die. Are they bad abilities due to their fallibility?

item.title: Court Wizard Rework
item.dc:creator: Navi
item.description:
Even when used this way it often led to unfortunate outcomes. Swapping a confirmed BD with a likely evil could lead to a Hunter/Alchemist being redirected to the BD and getting them killed. Even worse is when a knight CSes an evil and commits suicide because they were redirected, “confirming” the evil as BD.

I do support the idea of a CW change, but I’m not sure giving back infinite swaps is the way to do it

Read full topic

item.title: Court Wizard Rework
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Sounds like it should be unique then.

Also, it’s hard to see how a clever Court Wizard could fail to be useful. An example would be switching a high priority Blue Dragon with someone you think could be evil. Then if the BD is attacked, you protect them and take out an evil. It probably would be a more complicated class to pull off, though.

item.title: Court Wizard Rework
item.dc:creator: Navi
item.description:
Non-unique court wizards with infinite tornadoes was a thing a while back and wasn’t very fun, especially since back then occupy immunity didn’t stop the redirect and being redirected 3 times didn’t give immunity. It wasn’t uncommon to have your target switched two or more times a night and it was incredibly annoying for invest classes who would often end up being redirected to the same player multiple times over the course of a game. People also complained even when they were playing a court wizard, since it never felt like you achieved anything by switching people.

I guess it could be different now, since being redirected 3 times gives you immunity to it, but I’m not sure
